text: The Men's individual pursuit at the 2008 Summer Paralympics took place on September 7–9 at the Laoshan Velodrome. ==Classification== The cyclists are given a classification depending on the type and extent of their disability. The classification system allows cyclists to compete against others with a similar level of function. Cycling classes: *B&VI; 1–3: Blind and visually impaired cyclists *LC 1–4: Cyclists with a locomotor disability *CP 1–4: Cyclists with cerebral palsy ==B&VI; 1–3== The men's individual pursuit (B&VI; 1–3) took place on September 7.Gold Rush for GB on Day One , britishcycling.org.uk, September 7, 2008 {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |bgcolor="gold"|Gold |bgcolor="silver"|Silver |bgcolor="CC9966"|Bronze |- valign="top" | | | |- valign="top" | Kieran Modra Tyson Lawrence | Christian Venge David Llaurado | Bryce Lindores Steven George |- |} === Preliminaries === Q = Qualifier WR = World Record {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" ! The pre-event favorite to win the gold medal was reigning champion, Darren Kenny of Great Britain. {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |bgcolor="gold"|Gold |bgcolor="silver"|Silver |bgcolor="CC9966"|Bronze |- valign="top" | | | |- |} === Preliminaries === Q = Qualifier WR = World Record {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !
